intro: Borreria heteranthera, commonly known as the yellow borage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in shaded, moist areas. Borreria heteranthera is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
